If you have not received an email with your tracking updates, please log in to Backerkit to check your shipping status and email address.

Just a quick note: 
Yesterday we had to take care of some family/medical issues out of town, so please bear with us.  
98% of the US orders have been sent.   There are a few stragglers that needed more attention and we should be getting to those today.

In case anyone missed it, all US orders will be entering the USPS stream on TUESDAY.
If you received a tracking notification email, it's just an indication that your order was packaged and a label was printed.
No need to worry, your order is not stuck.
Also, all UK/EU orders will be going to our UK fulfillment partner (proprietors of thediceplace.com) tomorrow (MONDAY).

Risks and challenges
The adventure is written, edited, and laid out, and the final cover is almost ready to drop into place. Barring a few tweaks, the adventure is ready to publish!

However, things can go wrong with anything that goes into a manufacturing process. We have identified that delays in manufacturing could happen. So we have allowed additional time in our schedule to enable us to navigate any delay issues. If all goes to plan, we may even be able to deliver the project a little sooner.

We understand the printing process as we have printed a good number of books previous to this project, and we know how to communicate our ideas to the printer. We have discussed proofing requirements, so we know that when the printing press is started our book will match our specification requirements.

With projects like this there is nearly always something that costs more so it is good business sense to have some contingency for this, which we have built in to our costs.

No matter what problems may occur we will always keep our backers and supporters informed of all issues so that you are aware of the situation and how we are dealing with it.

UPDATE: NEW STRETCH GOALS REVEALED! At $12,750 we start unlocking expansion packs with new cards, rules, tokens, and gameplay mechanics! These expansions are included with your rewards!
Rubbin' is Racin' - Unlocked at $12,750 - Dare other racers to overtake you with this melee focused expansion. This pack expands what you can do with the Metal Scraps junk card, adding the Armor Plating upgrade, as well as the Wheel Scythes upgrade. It also allows an alternate rule for players to bring one metal scraps junk card with them to use as an unlimited use contraption to damage racers in the same space.  
Lube it Up - Unlocked at $13,500 - Get greased up and wonder why you never oiled your moving parts before with this messy expansion. This pack includes the Oil Can and Rubber Hosing junk cards, as well as the Grease Gun contraption which drops oil slick tokens on the map, forcing all players who pass them to avoid them or crash.  
Rampin' my Style - Unlocked at $14,250 - Jump over hazards instead of facing them head on with this lofty expansion. This pack includes the Ramp and Goggles contraption cards, as well as a new mechanic for dropping ramp tokens. These ramps allow you to make a drive check to jump over the next space on the board, but once its on the board, everyone behind you can use it too.  
Pit Stops - Unlocked at $15,000 - Top off your contraptions with this crafty expansion. This pack includes Junk Stand tokens which allow a player to draw two random junk cards as they pass by. Contraptions can now be made on the race track! This pack also adds the Autolube System upgrade which makes your racer handle better, more durable, but also more complex.
Junkyard Derby is a card-driven steampunk racing board game from the makers of the Pure Steam series of roleplaying game resources. In Junkyard Derby, players construct a racing machine from components found in the junk pile and battle down the track to the finish line. 
Check out the Rulebook 
Example Play Videos: 
You need to build quickly, because anyone can race after the third round of play. There are four components every racer needs to race: chassis, wheels, steering, and propulsion. Each component has its own attributes; some are quick and flimsy, others slow and sturdy. 
Our unique card design lets you envision your racer! The base game includes four options for each slot, creating lots of racer combinations!  
So many options!
Once you've built your racer, hit the streets! 
The basic track has 5 slots for random hazards!
But beware! The proprietor of the race didn't get permits, so there are plenty of hazards on the way to the finish line. These hazards may damage your racer or slow you down. Players can also target each other with effects to slow them down or damage their racers. While your racer is damaged, its attributes are reduced. Since it's made of junk, each time you take damage you roll to see if your racer falls apart. A failed check means your racer has a catastrophic failure, further reducing its stats...
This trope-heavy hazard can wreck your racer.
Fret not! These racers are expected to fall apart. They’re made out of junk, after all.. You can stop to repair damage at any point during the race, removing some damage each turn. Or you can build yourself with a Pneumatic Jack contraption, and discard it to remove ALL damage during a repair. 
Most of the cards you find in the deck are Junk cards, which are worthless by themselves. If you combine them in innovative ways, however, you can build an upgrade for your racer or a contraption to battle on the streets.  
Trade in a battery and magnet for an electromagnet!
Combine metal scraps, a magnet, and a lens for a compass!
There are six characters to choose from. Each character has unique stats they add to their racer, regardless of the components used. Additionally, each character has two unique abilities--one to use during the Prep phase  of the game (such as stealing a component from a foe) and another while racing (such as the ability to repair one damage on the fly).
The Bedlamite is a hot-headed brute who steals cards and plows through obstacles.
The Ructioneer is a stubborn racer who can mulligan and use contraptions easily.
2-6 Players
Ages 8+
30 minutes
Junkyard Derby is a game for two (2) to six (6) players ages eight (8) and up. It takes about 30 minutes to play. 
Inside the box, the base game has a race track board, approximately one hundred twenty (120) cards, one (1) die, fifty (50) damage tokens, six (6) player tokens. Please note: the quantity and quality of items will change as stretch goals are unlocked!
Initial mockup of contents
Junkyard Derby is expected to have an MSRP of $40 USD. Backing on Kickstarter ensures you get it at the best price, before it hits stores, and ensures your copy has all the unlocked stretch goals!

campaign.story:
These are the books that you've demanded. And we've assembled an all-star roster of talent to bring them to you. All we need now is a show of support to make these dreams (and nightmares) into reality.
This Kickstarter project will fund no fewer than four separate books. Three of these are long-form prose fiction books, that have been out-of-print for a long, long while. We'd also like to produce a new book that's been a fan request for quite a while: a book of strange creatures and bizarre flora that have never seen before. And that's just the beginning.
In the remote corners of wilderness, in the far islands of undiscovered country, the darkest and palest of the thickets... there be monsters. To date, IRONCLAW has told stories about the elite masters far removed from the squalid villages below, all fighting their petty battles over power and money. BOOK OF MONSTERS introduces far darker things that can't be reasoned with.
The Book of Monsters project is led by Tempe O'Kun (Nordguard, Sixes Wild, Windfall) and Ursula Vernon (Digger, It Made Sense At the Time, the Sumatran Biting Pear).
In the course of Ironclaw's bronze history, we were fortunate to publish three novels. These books have long since been out of print and unavailable.  But no more! Your pledges will let us bring these books back, and better than ever. Fully revised, newly-typeset, and formatted for both print media and digital versions.

The Book of Legend project is led by Tempe O'Kun (Nordguard, Sixes Wild, Windfall) and Norman Rafferty (Ironclaw, Myriad Song, Urban Jungle.)


 With your support, we'll be able to bring more people on board. Long-time favorites such as Jon Ascher (Ironclaw, Urban Jungle), Erin van Hiel (Dream-Carver), Trent Halvorsen (Scars) and the proverbial more. We also have the support of OneBookShelf.com, with their DriveThruRPG and DriveThruFIction networks for distribution.
Making these books has been a dream of ours, too. But it's been difficult assembling the talent to make it possible. Now, the stars are right, and we're lucky to have a dream team of award-winning authors, artists, and designers to bring it to you.

Wow, that was a huge last day! Thanks to all the new supporters who pledged just under the wire. (Out of every 6 people, one of you pledged your support in the last 24 hours.)

It's not enough just to get the funds. Our next step is assembling the books. One daunting task is the sheer variety of e-readers out there for fiction books. We've been consulting with experts on the best way to deliver our fiction, and we'll be assembling the books for distribution -- all re-mastered for the future. Watch this space. And thank you again for your support.

campaign.story:
"People don't need a reason to be awful to each other. They just need to survive. But people don't need a reason to survive, either. They just need each other. Figure that one out, you've got a shot of understanding why we're all still here."
- Tribeca Rockaway, sniper of the Dead Heroes gang
No one knows how long it's been since the world was blasted with nuclear radiation and became infected with the undead. Major cities were all but destroyed; transit is reduced to animals, wagons, and the occasional iron horse. The survivors of the Fall were the first strain of deviation from the human condition and were able to make it through the rapidly spreading epidemic.
Humanity has just started to rebuild, but large sections of the world are still irradiated or completely overrun by the undead. Small communities come together in a world where the concepts such as "democracy," "freedom," and "government" are newly reborn. Finding a community of decent size in this world is rare; finding one that has any concept of equality or morality is rarer still. 
Oh, and people have the unnerving ability to come back from the dead, regrown from the very virus that destroyed the world.
This is dystopia. The world is broken. It is up to you to pick up the pieces and make a new world from the remains of the old.
Dystopia Rising: Evolution is the latest edition of the Dystopia Rising post-apocalyptic tabletop roleplaying game, which quickly grew into a live-action sensation, and now comes full-circle back to it's tabletop roots. Onyx Path is pleased to update the earlier edition and incorporate elements from the live-action setting with Dystopia Rising: Evolution, a tabletop roleplaying game that presents a fresh and exciting take on the post-apocalypse genre. 
The Dystopia Rising: Evolution Kickstarter campaign is designed to enable us to create a hardcover core rulebook that will introduce the world, as well as setting up room for expansion and further exploration of the setting. We also want to get at least one print run into traditional distribution and available for sale at game and hobby stores. 
We want to create an 8.5" x 11" hardcover with a beautifully designed, evocative cover image, and full-color interior art. We estimate the book to be more than 250+ pages, and will be traditionally printed on high quality paper stock.
Cover design subject to change.
Dystopia Rising: Evolution will be powered by Onyx Path's Storypath system, and includes all the rules you need to play as a survivor in the post-apocalypse, including rules for creating characters for up to 24 different Strains, variations on humanity that survived the Fall. It also has details on the powers of faith and psionics, along with advice on running action-adventure stories, webs of personal intrigue, or procedural investigations. And, finally, dozens of antagonists, including a variety of zombies and raiders to use in your series.
Chapters include:
 Chapter One — A New Age: A look at the background of Dystopia Rising: Evolution, including some insight into the people that live in this post-apocalyptic world. 
 Chapter Two — Your Brothers and Sisters: The survivors of the Fall can be categorized into eight Lineages, which each have a handful of Strains that fight to reclaim the world that was destroyed. 
 Chapter Three — Knitting the Flesh: How to make a character for Dystopia Rising: Evolution. 
 Chapter Four — Rolling the Bones: The core rules of Dystopia Rising: Evolution, which stem from Onyx Path’s Storypath system. 
 Chapter Five — Acts of Violence: How to hurt people, and avoid being hurt. 
 Chapter Six — Wild Wild Wastes: How to survive the variety of environmental dangers in Dystopia Rising, as well as rules for salvaging and scavenging items and gear.
 Chapter Seven — Birds of a Feather: You can’t survive without making friends, and several factions and groups have popped up all over the wastes. 
 Chapter Eight — What You Believe: Faith in a higher power, or in something else entirely, helps many survivors get through the harsh days and long nights. 
 Chapter Nine — Brain Bleed: The Fall of humanity lead to a few benefits, including the discovery and cultivation of psychic potential. 
 Chapter Ten — Campfire Stories: The Storyguide is the person who helps the players experience the world of Dystopia Rising. 
 Chapter Eleven — Threats of the Wastes: Living in the wasteland is no picnic. If the weather and the lack of supplies won’t kill you, the zombies and raiders will. 
 Chapter Twelve — The Wasteland: No one is quite sure how things got to bad. But at least the new settlement of Philly del Phia offers a new chance for people to start fresh. 
 Chapter Thirteen — Let the Dead Lie: Every story has a beginning. This might be yours. 
Throughout this Kickstarter campaign, we will be posting complete previews of the Dystopia Rising: Evolution playtestmanuscript as backer-only updates.
Click HERE to see the Manuscript Preview download links
The Storypath systemis Onyx Path's rules set designed specifically to allow the sort of rules scaling necessary to seamlessly enable players to play ordinary people as well as characters with psi powers, and everything in between.  
The basics of the Storypath system should be familiar to anyone who has played many other Onyx Path games of survival or personal horror, as it is a 10-sided dice pool system, where in order to resolve an action you basically roll a number of dice equal to the character's Skill + Attribute and must roll an 8 or better a certain number of times in order to succeed in the action. 
That is the very basic resolution system, but we expand on that to further enhance how your gaming group can build their stories. Failing to hit your number of successes, or having more successes than your required amount, are built-in options in the rules. Here is a handy graphic that illustrates what we mean:
To further explain the basics of the Storypath system, here is a small PDF download that goes into more detail: SYSTEM PREVIEW PDF.
The primary goal of this Kickstarter campaign is to create the best version of Dystopia Rising: Evolution that is possible. Your support allows us to fund the best production, use the most appropriate components, and possibly even contract more art for the core book. We hope to not only deliver a beautiful hardcover book to all of our backers, but also fund at least one print run to be sold through distribution and into book and hobby stores that are so vital to our community.
Beyond that primary goal, we hope to gain additional funding to explore more of the world of Dystopia Rising: Evolution, possibly expanding into supplements or other accessories, as well as possibly building a portal for more community development. The greater our funding for this project, the more resources we are able to explore this shattered world.
Thirdly, we want to celebrate and build on the existing Dystopia Rising fan base, further exploring and developing the world that they've built and forging a shared and strong community. We'll have opportunities for some crossover and integration as we move forward by presenting special Reward Tiers and Stretch Goals.
Beyond all of those campaign-specific goals, we hope to do what our games have always done — open a path to a new world; a setting for our community to build new stories and entwine imaginations. Every person who participates in this campaign is joining with the goal of bringing this game into the world — and like our protagonists, this creed binds us with with common purpose. When you back this project, you join our burgeoning society and we evolve and grow together.
All participants who would like to make this project happen can pledge their support and add to the overall campaign total. If the campaign meets the funding target ($20,000), then we will have funded the project and it will become a reality. Your pledge will only be collected if we achieve our funding target.
In thanks for your support, we offer rewards based on your level of funding pledged. The Reward Tiers down the right side of the page outline the various rewards reflecting various levels of support pledged. Please note that rewards may automatically add additional charges to cover shipping expenses.
Click to see a LARGER version of this chart.
To help simplify matters, the Reward Chart lists the core reward and then combinations with each of the additional rewards offered as part of this campaign (see Reward Descriptions, below).
Key Decision: do you save some shelf space and go digital-only with the PDF version, or go all in with the Hardcover + PDF reward? Please note that physical rewards may automatically add additional charges to cover shipping expenses.
Backers looking to receive multiple copies should also note the DIGGER and TOY BOX Reward Tiers, which offer 2 or 5 copies respectively as part of the rewards (and may save on shipping per unit!)
Finally, we love retailers, but modern publishing methods don’t always make it easy for them to get books into their stores. With this Dystopia Rising: Evolution campaign, we have created a special Reward Tier just for you. Any retailer who pledges at the Retailer Reward Tier level ("MASS GRAVE") will get 5 copies of the hardcover book, PDF, and Reference Screen at a retail-specific discount so that they can sell in-store.
Several Reward Tiers offer special limited or premium rewards in addition to the basics, including everything from a Creed symbol enamel pin to an opportunity to own a one-of-a-kind Dystopia Rising artifact. We also have tiers with BOOK PLATE Stickers which will be signed by as many of the creative team as we can wrangle, an option to act as a ART MODEL (either as a human survivor or a decaying zombie), as well as a chance to NAME an NPC included in the Dystopia Rising: Evolution core book or a possible supplement. Finally, a limited number of premium slots to play in a tabletop rpg session with the Onyx Path creative team at Gen Con 2019, or with Michael Pucci at 2019 Midwinter Convention in an event that will bridge the continuity between the LARP and Dystopia Rising: Evolution timeline. Check each of the Reward Tier descriptions for more details.
ACCESS TO MANUSCRIPT PREVIEW UPDATES – During the course of the campaign, we will be posting the ENTIRE manuscript for Dystopia Rising: Evolution. These previews will be shared via Backer-Only updates once per week. You must be a backer of this project to receive these updates.
Click here for Backers-only manuscript previews

OPTIONAL "AT COST" PoD VERSION – All PDF products will be fulfilled through our partners at DriveThruRPG.com, the largest RPG download store. For Dystopia Rising: Evolution, you will have the option of using DriveThruRPG’s Print-On-Demand service to purchase a physical, printed copy directly from their PoD partners at as close as we can get to the cost of printing and shipping (this cost is not included in your pledge, and you do not need to increase the cost of your pledge to use this option). When the PoD versions are available to order (which will be some time after the hardcover has gone to print), you will receive links to purchase these versions of the book from DriveThruRPG.com. You DO NOT need to take advantage of this PoD offer as it does not affect in any way your pledge rewards.

All physical items that will require shipping (additional hardcover books, screens, pins) can only be added to reward tiers that already include a hardcover copy of the Dystopia Rising: Evolution core rules (Reward Tiers of $50+). As we increase the overall funding and support for the project, we’re able to add additional resources to the project, expand the rewards listed, and add in new offers and opportunities. Each Stretch Goal will have a target that, once reached, will add a project to the reward list. We will continue to build on this list when we achieve these targets during the campaign. Whenever we achieve a stretch goal, the image will be updated to reflect the achievement.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Risk: This game isn't created at all even though the goal is reached.

Solution: We have successfully shipped many Kickstarter projects and more are headed to completion as you read this. All those projects have taught us how the various pieces of the process works, and we have increased our ability to judge the various stages of delivery better with each KS. The text for Dystopia Rising: Evolution is finished, initial interior artwork has been contracted, so the development process is well underway.

Risk: Shipping costs soak up pledges that were meant to enable the creation of the book.

Solution: Kickstarter shipping costs have continued to rise this last year, but we are aware of that and were able to find ways to work with shippers to bring down those costs - unfortunately, only to some extent as we have also needed to up the shipping charges- both methods allowing us to be sure that shipping doesn't eat up the pledge money supposed to go to printing.

Risk: The game will take a long time to produce and anger the backers.

Solution: We've learned many, many lessons with our previous Kickstarters and we're becoming much better at estimating the various pitfalls that will delay a KS project. We were able to deliver the PDFs for our last several KS projects several months before the estimate, and our recent campaigns have delivered rewards earlier than estimated.

That being said, backers need to be aware that they are enabling a process, and not a pre-order opportunity, and things do sometimes run slower than we want or anticipate with that process. We've found that an open flow of communication between us and the backer community is vital so once the project funds we will deliver Updates on progress once a month (or more, as needed) via Kickstarter as well as in our regular, weekly, Monday Meeting Notes blog at www.theonyxpath.com

ADDITIONAL TERMS & CONDITIONS

By backing this Kickstarter project, you have agreed to the following additional terms and conditions:

ARTWORK, DESIGN, MATERIAL & CONTENTS SUBJECT TO CHANGE. Onyx Path shares artwork, design, descriptions and manuscript contents with the understanding that changes may occur in the creation of the final product based on further development, available resources and materials, and the nature of the creative process.

REWARDS REQUIRING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION REQUIRE TIMELY RESPONSE. Some rewards, particularly limited Special Rewards such as art model descriptions, character names, and custom design work, require input from the reward backer. For these rewards, the backer must respond within 6 weeks of the information being requested (most likely by BackerKit pledge manager survey, occasionally by direct e-mail) in order to maintain the project development and manufacturing timeline. Onyx Path will make a strong effort to acquire this information, but should the backer not provide it in a timely fashion, all parties agree that Onyx Path can move forward on the project without the information or using an appropriate substitution and the respective backer will consider the reward obligation fulfilled in full for payment or donations pledged and collected on the part of Onyx Path. The simple fact is that we cannot delay the production of the product due to a unresponsive backer, that's just not fair to the others who have supported this project.

ADDRESS CONFIRMATION & DELIVERY OBLIGATIONS. If you confirm your pledge prior to final address confirmation and initiation of distribution notification via email, you agree that our responsibility to you is to ship your order as entered into our pledge manager system, that title and risk passes to you upon delivery to a common carrier for such shipment, and you are responsible for import duties or any other duties that may be payable to the relevant tax authorities, providing correct address information and ensuring this address is deliverable by normal methods. Failure to confirm mailing address prior to final request and distribution notification will be taken as agreement that all obligations have been met and no further action or effort is required on the part of Onyx Path. We will attempt to alert you via the methods provided by Kickstarter and/or BackerKit, primarily e-mail, prior to distribution of rewards to avoid any issue, but once we’ve made all reasonable efforts, we must move on with other business and will be unable to make exceptions.

DIGITAL REWARDS. You will be notified by BackerKit when digital rewards become available to you. Typically, these will be links to load PDF titles into your account library on DriveThruRPG.com. The links from BackerKit must be activated within 90 days to ensure the titles are added to your library, after which the links may expire and Onyx Path may not be able to provide replacements.

If you do not accept these terms, please do not pledge on this project but instead wait for the general release.

Hello Risers,
A quick update at the end of June.
Last month I mentioned the Onyx Path Virtual Gaming Convention for 2021. There were many great panels and games and I hope you were able to check some of them out. Next month, I'm hoping to have a recording of the Storypath panel that I can share with you.

Hello Risers,
Hello Changelings,
Nothing much on our final Stretch Goal reward yet, I'm afraid. We're still seeing the fallout from 2020, as Onyx Path recovers from a million little schedule shifts and productivity hits from the past 16 months. I think they've got a lot sorted out, and I'm hopeful we'll soon see the fruits of their efforts.
But you can probably find out a lot more about that in a few weeks...

Hello Risers,
We've got our final project still stuck in the editing pile up from the 2020/21 pandemic mess, but there are still Dystopia Rising: Evolution projects sneaking through.
NOW AVAILABLE AT DRIVETHRURPG.COM

Hello Risers,
The past year is responsible for a lot of schedule shifting and resource management trials, so there are a few bottlenecks still to clear on the project progress pathway. I know that the team have been recruiting additional help - I'm hoping that everything can get unstuck and moving once again soon.
So, quick and quiet update for this month.

Hello Risers,
Shortest month of the  year, shortest update I'll send out.
No word yet on our final reward. It's still in Editing, hopefully finishing up and out to us before too much longer.
REWARD TRACKING - Completed Rewards (Sent to Backers)

Hello Risers!
Welcome to the first update of 2021. Last year obviously knocked a bunch of things around and through off some schedules. I'm hopeful that things will get back on track and we'll all have a better year.

Hey Dystopian Risers,
Well, our game is all about building back our communities after extreme hardship and difficulties and disaster, and if that doesn't give me a theme for a look ahead to 2021, I don't know what would. This year has been a test of endurance and fortitude, and I hope that next year we can explore some of the themes of this game - reconnecting with our communities, adapting and overcoming challenges, and working to make the world a better place.

Hey Dystopian Risers,
Well, I spent yesterday trying to sneak in a month end updates before our American friends take some Thanksgiving time off, but Kickstarter wasn't letting me upload images. And where would I be if I couldn't insert my avatar here?

Hello Dystopian Rising Kickstarter Community,
No major updates this month, just slow progress and a few revisions as we move closer to completing our campaign. But, it's the (almost) end of the month, so let's check in to see where we are.

Hello Dystopian Rising Kickstarter Community,
It's the final week of September, and time for our regular month end status update. No big announcements this month - we've got one project left, one final Stretch Goal reward, but we're still suffering from the delays in the process thanks to the pandemic. Let's review!

Welcome to our Kickstarter for a set of hard enamel badges featuring some of the most wicked and insidious Cthulhu Mythos cults ever known! 
Last year we produced a beautiful set of Mythos book badges, and we've returned with a fresh new take with these cultists badges.

Display your cultist status with these fabulous Mythos-themed Cthulhu badges! Ideal for displaying on your person, dice bag, game gear, or even a hat!
We are looking for your backing to fund this set of badges!
------------------------------------------------------------
NEW STRETCH GOAL ANNOUNCED!  
Having unleashed the cults of the Mythos, we're now proud to announce a stretch goal badge - The Esoteric Order of Dagon badge!  
Stretch Goal Target £3500
Esoteric Order of Dagon  
During the 1830s, Captain Obed Marsh traded with the degenerate natives of an unnamed Pacific island. Through their chief, Walakea, he learned terrible rites that would allow him to summon Deep Ones. Returning to his native Innsmouth, Marsh founded the Esoteric Order of Dagon, a secretive cult that has since spread its fell influence throughout the entire town.
ALL BACKERS (apart from folk selecting the No Reward pledge level) will receive the Esoteric Order of Dagon badge completely FREE as part of their rewards!
We have just one pledge level for this Kickstarter. If you're quick to the party (or cult gathering, if you prefer), you can get the badge set at a small discount! This early bird will not be available after 100 backers have pledged for them!
We've just released a very special and VERY LIMITED pledge level that includes the first set of Mythos Book Badges! Grab it while you can!
This set of five badges are made from die struck metal and hard enamel colors. Each badge comes with a butterfly catch.  
Designed in house at Triple Ace Games, the Mythos Badges are a unique collectible item.
Servants of the Heretic Pharaoh
What few fragments of lore exist concerning Nephren-Ka speak of him as an insane pharaoh who instigated abolished the old faith in favor of dark rites honoring a monstrous deity. After his death, the name of the great heretic was erased from the list of kings and queens, and all statues and inscriptions bearing his name smashed. A cult in his name still exists today. Its goal is to locate his earthly remains and return them to life so that he may start a new reign of terror.
Cult of the Black Hand
The Islamic sect known in the West as the Assassins were led by the Old Man of the Mountain. The Old Man was, in fact, an avatar of Nyarlathotep. None ever saw his full form, for it was wrapped in a voluminous black robe, save for his withered and blackened right hand. With a touch of this gnarled limb he could bestow his worshipers with supernatural abilities or condemn them to a grisly death.
Illuminated Fraternity of the All-Seeing Eye
Whereas many cults appeal to those at the lower end of the social spectrum, the Illuminated Fraternity counts among its ranks businessmen, politicians, and military officers, plus a few aristocrats. The cult has a single goal—authoritarian world domination. Nations and religions will be swept aside in favor of worship of the All- Seeing Eye, a single global government, and a common language.
Black Scorpion Brotherhood
Founded in Predynastic Upper Egypt during the rule of a king known to modern Egyptologists as Scorpion I, the vile cult not only remains strong today, it has spread beyond Egypt. The Brotherhood (which accepts women) has no real unity and no long-term goals. Instead, members are encouraged to engage in their wildest desires and perversions.
Elder Sign
The Elder Sign is a protective ward. Invoked as a hand gesture, it serves the same function as protection against the evil eye or crossing oneself —comforting, but ultimately without benefit. Carved into something solid—rock, glass, wood, or even precious metal—enchanted with magic, and worn openly, it provides a defense against the minions of the Great Old Ones.
We understand that you may wish to get 2, 3, or even 4 sets of badges for friends, family, or fellow cultists! 
We've got you covered with that! We've even given you a little saving on additional sets! How do you include add-ons? Well that is super easy!
If you've already pledged, just click on MANAGE MY PLEDGE and add the extra amount required to get your desired add-ons!
When you pledge, shipping will not be included during the Kickstarter campaign. We will be using Backerkit to manage the surveys and shipping costs once the campaign ends. Triple Ace Games began in 2008. The masterminds behind the company, Paul "Wiggy" Wade-Williams and Robin Elliott, had previously worked on The Savage World of Solomon Kane and Slipstream settings, among others, for Pinnacle Entertainment Group. Triple Ace Games has produced many popular settings, including Hellfrost, Leagues of Adventure, Leagues of Gothic Horror, Leagues of Cthulhu, and All for One: Regime Diabolique, plus the Rocket Race, Cadaver, Imps, and Halfling Feast card games. With many years of experience in the games industry, we continue to create fantastic games for everyone.

campaign.story:
Our 11th Kickstarter - "Creatures from Fairy-Tales and Myth" will come in 3 book formats: (1) an illustrated story book for those who love to read about mythic creatures... (2) a bestiary book for the Fate of the Norns: Ragnarok role-playing game...  (3) a monster manual for the DnD 5e RPG using the open gaming license (OGL).
...if you love the stories by the brothers Grimm, the Icelandic Sagas, or works by Andrew Lang or Alexander Afanasyev, then please read on...
 This book is for those who love to read fairy-tales, sagas and myths. This is not a game book (scroll down for the 2 game books).
Download a PDF example of our story book:
http://fateofthenorns.com/img/Creatures-of-Myth-and-Legend-STORY-BOOK.pdf
A sample of our attention to detail and production values can be seen here:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5A6ouWJRl9k
This is a brand new lore book for the Fate of the Norns: Ragnarok game system.
Take a look at this sample preview of the FOTN edition:
http://www.fateofthenorns.com/img/Creatures-of-Myth-and-Legend-FOTNR.pdf
This is much more than a monster manual for your 5e d20 game (using the OGL).
Take a look at this sample preview of the 5e d20 edition:
http://www.fateofthenorns.com/img/Creatures-of-Myth-and-Legend-d20.pdf
We are always pleased to offer Kickstarter exclusives to those who help us make ideas into reality. Here are extras that you can add to your pledge by increasing your overall pledge amount based on what you would like.
+$120 A linen tapestry of either Midgard or Yggdrasil (shipping extra)
Midgard image:
http://www.fateofthenorns.com/img/FOTNR-Midgard-WM-logo_x3100.jpg
Yggdrasil image:
http://www.fateofthenorns.com/img/FOTN-Yggdrasil-WM_logo_x3500.jpg
+$40 An extra copy of "Creatures from Fairy-Tale and Myth" in another format than what you backed (POD and shipping extra).
+$20 An extra PDF copy of "Creatures from Fairy-Tale and Myth" in another format than what you backed
+$33 Gain access to the War of Shadow BETA. This will grant access to the evolving rule-book right up to the War of Shadow Kickstarter. This also includes special promo codes for game card decks at cost.
Andrew Valkauskas is a published author, game designer, and Viking. He has been designing games since the early 90's (first computer games and then table-top RPGs) and publishing short-stories and mythology books for the last few years. His passion for history, mythology, and gaming has brought researched lore into the table-top game milieu.
Andrew's recent projects include the Illuminated Edda, a modern and authentic retelling of both the prose and poetic Eddas (Scandianvian mythology). He is the creator of Fate of the Norns, a table-top RPG series that uses a revolutionary rune-based game engine instead of dice. He was the designer behind Gulveig the card game, and was the producer behind Vanagard the brand new collaborative story-telling game.
Having played every edition of D&D since the late 70's, Andrew is eager to contribute a manuscript to this hugely influential game.
As with all of our previous book-based kickstarters, we will be using print-on-demand fulfillment. This has proven to shorten the wait time and lower the cost- which adds savings for our backers. Our partner DriveThruRPG has North American and EU fulfillment centers making shipping much more affordable. With all of the trade disputes going on between nations right now, it is the safest way to guarantee drama-free delivery.

campaign.story:
Imperial Jupiter Cover Art
Imperial Jupiter
Cover Art by by ReOnna Smith
Art work in the video by ReOnna Smith, Peter Saga, and Miguel Santos
Jupiter, largest planet in the Solar System, has finally been detailed for the Rocket Age RPG. As a setting book, Imperial Jupiter offers the detail, iconic NPCs, and story hooks you would expect from a Rocket Age product.
Learn more about Rocket Age RPG from Why Not Games.
Ancient Artwork in Imperial Jupiter by ReOnna Smith
Explore the sky islands of Jupiter, brave the terrors of the Great Red Spot, and descend into the fiery heart of the planet where the temperature and pressure can crush a rocket ship like a tin can. The Jovians are given some love throughout this chapter and the rest of the book, as is right since Jupiter is their planet. Or is it? Alien species are coming to Jupiter in small numbers, but once there they tend to stay. The Jovians have only recently emerged from hiding in the depths of the planet's atmosphere only to discover that they are not alone.
When you're done return to the Anglo-American Air Docks to rest and refit, or find all new types of trouble in the hanging warrens of Down Below or the politically charged halls of diplomats and businesses. The Docks are the central hub for games set in the Jovian System, a place to seek adventure as much to find it. Tell Rainsong we said, "hi".
Imperial Jupiter is more than just a single planet, the major moons offer danger and adventure, wealth and death in equal amounts.
Europan Food Artwork in Imperial Jupiter by ReOnna Smith
Io is a post-apocalyptic wasteland of marauding mutants and dangerous monsters. Explorers come here to loot the ruins of Io from before the Europans blasted the moon, and hope they do not fall prey to the toxic environment or the deadly creatures that inhabit it, not to mention the Ioites themselves. Some of the greatest dangers on the moon are weapons left over from the war that ended Io's rise to challenge Europa for supremacy.
Fungi Artwork in Imperial Jupiter by ReOnna Smith
Ganymede is a cool forested moon where all life is plant or fungus based. There is a war growing on Ganymede as the natives battle Earthlings and others who have come to exploit rich timber and mineral resources. Not only do we detail the moon, but also we give information about the native Ganymedians. Watch out for the thorn-elk.
Thorn-Elk Artwork in Imperial Jupiter
Europa is off limits to all other species, but in lieu of visiting that planet Imperial Jupiter reveals the secrets behind the Europans. Their origins, their government, technology, and even their fie separate sexes are detailed. Questions long asked, such as what the Europans are up to, why they are so odd, and what planet will they disintegrate first are answered.
New equipment and character traits provide something for everyone. There are new toys for Europans, Jovians, and Ganymedians to play with, and examples of the cutting edge of Earthling technology. Included in the latter are the deadly Volksuntertasse II of the Nazi rocket force.
Death Worm in Imperial Jupiter by ReOnna Smith
The life of Jupiter is bizarre and does not fit into the categories Earthlings have founded their science on. Then again, the walking and talking plants of Ganymede turn standard theories of biology and evolution on their ears. It might be best that we don't even talk about the strange and terrible mutant beasts that haunt the wastelands of that moon. Of course we discuss all of these and more, each creature offered with stats, story hooks, and stunning artwork by ReOnna Smith.
Funds
The money we raise from this kickstarter will pay the artists, the editor, printing costs, shipping in the United States, and distribution fees.  Layout of the book is by Krystal and writing by Ken, co-owners of Why Not Games. From the day we bought back the IP and started Why Not Games, we have been looking forward to and working towards this next book of the Rocket Age series. 
Following the fulfillment of this kickstarter we will release Imperial Jupiter, a source book for Rocket Age RPG, in print and PDF though Drive-Thru RPG, Studio 2, and our webstore.
Shipping Information
DriveThruRPG.com is our print on demand supplier.
We are working with Studio 2 for order fulfillment. We will notify all backers regarding shipping to the United States, the EU, and around the world as soon as we have exact costs. 

PDFs will be sent as a link via DriveThruRPG.com.
NEW! Imperial Jupiter Stretch Goals
Imperial Jupiter covers three of the Jovian moons, Europa, Ganymede, and Io. As we pass these stretch goals we will add a chapter covering another moon, as well as sections in the Ecology and New Equipment chapters.
$3250- Callisto
Callisto Unlocked!
Home to the fearsome Yeti, Callisto is a frozen world of glaciers, icy seas, and vast fields of snow. Brave the cold and deadly native fauna to learn more about the origins of the Yeti and explore ruins of Lost Eris!
$3750- Metis
Metis Unlocked!
The Metisians are an Europan client species and form the backbone of the Europan military. For centuries their forest-covered moon was infected by a virulent plague that drove the Metisans underground. Now with the Europans having cured the plague the Metisians are able to explore their own home, but who knows what they will find?
$4250- Amalthea
Amalthea Unlocked!
Never before covered in Rocket Age, Amalthea is a small moon that supports a bizarre and toxic atmosphere. What wonders lie there and why do they hint at strange signals from beyond the orbit of Saturn?
All Stretch Goals are Unlocked! Thank you for backing Imperial Jupiter!
Add-Ons
An experienced rocket hand or new to Rocket Age, you might want these additional products from Why Not Games:
Rocket Age Corebook (powered by the Vortex system)
$10 for PDF only
$40 for hard cover print plus PDF 
Blood Red Mars (the sourcebook covering Mars and Martians)$10 for PDF only
$30 for soft cover print plus PDF 
Lure of Venus (all about the jungle planet Venus and the Venusians who live there)
$10 for PDF only
$30 for soft cover print plus PDF 
Heroes of the Solar System (a player's guide offering four new species, including the Jovians and Metisians, as well as traits, equipment, and organizations to join or fight against)$10 for PDF only
$25 for soft cover print plus PDF 
Trail of the Scorpion (a six-part campaign on the trail of the Red Scorpion, the Solar System's greatest criminal mastermind)
$10 for PDF only
$25 for soft cover print plus PDF 
Tales from the Rocket Age (Four short fiction stories set in the Rocket Age)
$2 for PDF only $9 for soft cover print plus PDF 
Lift Off Bundle (Rocket Age Corebook and Heroes of the Solar System) $15 for PDF only
$55 for print plus PDF 
All in Bundle (Rocket Age Corebook, Blood Red Mars, Lure of Venus, Heroes of the Solar System, Trail of the Scorpion, and Tales from the Rocket Age)$40 for PDF only
$130 for print plus PDF 
Why Not Games - www.whynotgames.com
Ken Spencer, co-owner ENnie award winning creator of Rocket Age, Ken is our creative director and lead writer. He has written for Cubicle 7 Entertainment, Chaosium, Frog God Games, Alephtar Games, and Steve Jackson Games. Educated as an archaeologist, geographer, and teacher, Ken brings experience as a field scientist to his writing, adding a certain verisimilitude to exploring ancient ruins and traveling through unexplored wildernesses. 
Krystal Faller Spencer, co-owner 
Our nationally award winning marketing director and business manager, Krystal keeps the lights on and the fridge stocked. Her many years in broadcasting have taught her how to tell a complex story in a short amount of time, something necessary for when Ken starts to ramble. Krystal is also a life long Cubs fan, which worked out well for her once.
ReOnna Smith, Freelance Artist
https://moriarteacup.wixsite.com/bunnygardenparty
Creatures of myths, legends, superheros or seemingly normal humans have always been the main subjects within personal works. It is just more fun that way and keeps things interesting. Why settle for normal when otherworldly is an option.
Peter Saga, Freelance Artist
http://www.drivethrurpg.com/browse/pub/8357/Peter-Saga https://artofpetersaga.wixsite.com/mysite
I specialize in Sci-Fi RPG illustration and have been professionally published for over 5 years now by numerous small press companies.
My line artwork has appeared in Pathways Magazine, and in Gygax Magazine issue #2!
Fulfillment by Studio 2

Imperial Jupiter print copies have arrived at the fulfillment center and are being processed, packed, and shipped! updates.update_userinfo: Imperial Jupiter is at the printer!
updates.update_content:
We received the third proof of Imperial Jupiter and the issues have been fixed, and the printer has been cleared to begin printing. Once printed, the books will be sent to the fulfillment center and then on to backers. As both our printer and fulfillment center are in the US, there will not be the long wait on a slow boat from China you so often find in tabletop kickstarters.
Once the books are on the way to the fulfillment center we will let everyone know.

Greetings all,
The pdfs for Imperial Jupiter and all add-ons will be going out tomorrow. You will receive an email with the appropriate links to download the files. We will leave a window open for 7 days during which if you find an error in Imperial Jupiter you can send it to krystal@whynotgames.com. For those Rangers who recall the long ago early days of Rocket Age, yes, you still get to tell your GM you have a free Story Point if you find an error*. If they argue, tell them Ken said so.

We are behind schedule, but not by much. The first round of proofing is done and we have had a second print produced and it is now in our hands. There are a few issues we need to fix with the printer so that the books are perfect, right now we are trying to sort out why some pages are off center by a few millimeters.
Once the final review is done we will be making any necessary changes and getting the pdf out. Hopefully, as they say around here, if the weather holds and the creek doesn't rise, sometime late next week. Print fulfillment will begin as soon as the printer and shipper can manage it.

Greetings all. I apologize for being late with this update but we wanted to make sure we had something to say.
-BackerKit is live until 10/9, most of you have replied. You can also share the link here with friends who missed the Kickstarter so they can preorder Imperial Jupiter, though not at Kickstarter prices. You can add more add-ons in the BackerKit as well.
-All art is in, layout is done, and we are proofing before going on to printing and fulfillment!

Greetings all,
-Layout continues, Krystal is on the other side of the office working on it right now.
-We are waiting on four art pieces.
-Still working on the backer kit. We are trying to make sure the international shipping turns out right.

-Layout progresses and we are waiting on only four pieces of art.
-Backerkit is waiting on final approval. We have struggled with the shipping calculations but hopefully everything turns out right.
-Art preview, the Thebans, a new playable species:

Imperial Jupiter is coming along nicely.
. -Backerkit is in its last stages of being finished and approved. When it is ready you will receive notification.
- All text is completed, edited, and ready for layout.
-All art for the main text should be in by today.

It has been a busy week here at Why Not Games.
- Backerkit will be out in a week or so. Instructions on how to navigate it will be in a separate update. We are working on a way to take pre-orders from those who missed the kickstarter, pre-orders (for non-backers) will be at full retail price.
-Art for the main text is 95% complete, we are still waiting on three pieces.

campaign.story:
Legacy of Darkness is the first adventure from DANGER MAGNET, utilizing the Ubiquity system made popular by fan-favorite Exile Game Studio's Hollow Earth Expedition.
Legacy of Darkness is a thrilling adventure set within the pulp-inspired imaginations of tabletop gamers the world over. Your characters will scour the surface world of Europe in a race against the Nazis to discover one of the greatest treasure hordes lost to antiquity:
The lost treasure of Vlad Tepes, the man the world would come to know as Dracula.
Legacy of Darkness combines the action, adventure, and thrills of your favorite pulps and serial movies with the mystery and horror from the golden age of cinema. Creating a one of a kind adventure that will leave your players excited for more.
Legacy of Darkness is a long adventure that will take most groups 3-6 sessions to complete with several options left to the game master to spin off more adventures in the future.
 Legacy of Darkness is a complete adventure that can be utilized by an already existing group of characters, or played using the iconic playable characters such as Dirk Savage, Lillian Vaile, John Choi, and the mysterious Zamira Escarra, or the game master and players can create all new characters making use of the character creation guide that will help any party ensure they are ready to take on the Legacy of Darkness.
It is planned to be a 60-page adventure that may grow as the Kickstarter grows.
Legacy of Darkness will contain all the stats for all the enemies faced (no need to go looking through all your core rulebooks), sinister traps, perplexing puzzles, tactics for encounters that contain combat, as well as a few new and original adversaries that the characters will have to overcome if they wish to learn the secret of the Legacy of Darkness.
The adventure will contain tips from the creators on how to bring each scene to life, how to complicate it to challenge the characters further, as well as suggestions on how to describe scenes for all the senses.
During the Kickstarter campaign, there will be opportunities to unlock a new Talent, a Motivation, as well as a new Archetype.
 Danger Magnet is made up of Mike Dukes, Lauren Gray, Nich Gray, and Shawn Hilton.
Legacy of Darkness is a passion project for this group of creators who have worked with Exile Game Studio for over a decade. With credits in Secrets of the Surface Worlds, Mysteries of the Hollow Earth, Revelations of Mars, Perils of the Surface worlds, numerous Exile Game Studio Free Roleplaying Game day adventures, as well as acting as the GM coordinator for Exile Game Studio at GenCon and Origins.
The adventures created by the DANGER MAGNET team specifically for Exile Game Studios Ubiquity System include the Dirk Savage Adventures, Wilderness Adventure Kids, Six Guns of Death, Nazi Hunter, and many more have been fan favorites over the last decade at GenCon. These adventures have led the DANGER MAGNET TEAM to 5 Best GM of the year awards presented by Exile Game Studio.
Other credits include Atomic Highway, Quantum Black, Pulp Fantastic, Hood, ETU: Degrees in Horror, Deadlands, Dawn of Legends, G.E.T. Into Action, Iron Dynasty, Agents of Oblivion, and multiple videos for successful Kickstarters.
Legacy of Darkness is fully authorized and licensed by Exile Game Studio.
   NEW STRETCH GOALS ADDED!

In conjunction with QUANTUM BLACK GAMES DANGER MAGNET will hire up and coming gaming sensation ALEX THOMAS to create a short (1000 -1500 word) adventure that will touch upon the events that unfold in LEGACY OF DARKNESS.

 This Adventure will be created using the QUANTUM BLACK setting and see the fallout of LEGACY OF DARKNESS in the modern age.
 From the Gothic Horror of LEGACY OF DARKNESS to the SURVIVAL HORROR OF QUANTUM BLACK the LEGACY OF DARKNESS casts a LONG SHADOW! 

 This adventure will be included in all pledges from the YOU have RELEASED the DARKNESS ($15.00) level AND UP! DANGER MAGNET wants to thank our friends at QUANTUM BLACK for making this crossover possible.
The Legacy of Darkness crept forward to modern day with a Quantum Black tie-in adventure with the last stretch goal. This time, we go backwards in time to the 1890's for a Leagues of Gothic Horror tie-in! 
None other than our friend Wiggy Wade-Williams of Triple Ace Games will create a secret society for Leagues of Gothic Horror that has ties to the Legacy of Darkness! And to accompany this, our own Nich Gray will write  a short (1000 - 1500 word) adventure to go along with it! PLUS a digital copy of Triple Ace Games' Guide to Vampires for all pledge levels of $15+!
This society and Adventure will be created using the Leagues of Gothic Horror setting and see some of the early days of LEGACY OF DARKNESS in the Victorian age.
From the Gothic Horror of LEGACY OF DARKNESS to the PENNY DREADFUL HORROR OF LEAGUES OF GOTHIC HORROR the LEGACY OF DARKNESS casts a LONG SHADOW!
This adventure will be included in all pledges from the YOU have RELEASED the DARKNESS ($15.00) level AND UP! DANGER MAGNET wants to thank our friends at TRIPLE ACE GAMES for making this crossover possible.
 The sinister reach of the LEGACY OF DARKNESS extends ever further and is breaking all the rules! Achieving this stretch goal means that our friend Wiggy Wade-Williams of Triple Ace Games will break his own rules! He will create a unique character for one backer drawn at random.
This will be a full-page (6x9 format) character, but with a twist that breaks the rules as written - they'll be a half-vampire! And being written by Wiggy, it means it is official! And, half-vampires don't age, so this character can participate in all of the eras of LEGACY OF DARKNESS!
And what else do you get? Why, an All for One adventure (1000-1500 words) by our own Mike Dukes to put your musketeers through their paces! That's right! All for One, Leagues of Gothic Horror and Quantum Black! Try as you might, there is no escaping the LEGACY OF DARKNESS!
Don your hat, strap on your sword and tell your lackey to ready your horse! There is EVIL afoot! 
This adventure will be included in all pledges from the YOU have RELEASED the DARKNESS ($15.00) level AND UP! DANGER MAGNET wants to thank our friends at TRIPLE ACE GAMES for making this crossover possible.
The LEGACY OF DARKNESS has crept forward in time to Quantum Black and cast its shadow back to not only Leagues of Gothic Horror, but All for One as well. Now, we cross dimensions and planes of existence! At $6,000, Matt Somers, the author of Desolation, will write a 1,000-1,500 word tie-in adventure set in that apocalyptic fantasy realm!
Heed the call to action! The lands of Scondera need you!
This adventure will be included in all pledges from the YOU have RELEASED the DARKNESS ($15.00) level AND UP! DANGER MAGNET wants to thank our friends at GREYMALKIN DESIGNS for making this crossover possible.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Every startup faces certain risks in the creation of their first project. 

Luckily the Danger Magnet team has already produced work for several companies in a timely manner, has the skills (four times over) to create a thrilling adventure in Legacy of Darkness, the technical expertise to layout and produce a polished finished product.

The outline for Legacy of Darkness was finished long before the Kickstarter was begun. The rough draft for two of the three acts is nearly finished with the third expected to be finished within a week of this Kickstarter going live. With the power of four creators working together we expect to finish the entire project quite quickly.

The cover for Legacy of Darkness was completed before the Kickstarter went live as well as the full-color art for all four Iconic characters. Danger Magnet is continuing to work with the artist throughout the project to ensure that all art is in hand in a prompt fashion.

Fulfillment is expected to be done through Drive Thru RPG which has a long and well-respected reputation for not only delivering product, but also allows for a better shipping rate to our European customers.

By avoiding the pitfalls of adding too many physical items to our first Kickstarter we believe we are in the best possible position to deliver a quality product that will exceed expectations as well as deliver in a timely fashion.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

ROGUES GALLERY
You will name a non-essential non player character (name must be approved by DANGER MAGNET) that will appear in Legacy of Darkness, and be useable by game masters.
Will include named character, short stat line, and one paragraph bio. Will include character types such as: Doctor, Law Enforcement, Pilot, Clergy, etc.
How is this different than Casting Call for Legacy of Darkness?
The Casting Call for Legacy of Darkness will include non-player character central to the scenes they are in, and the characters will deal with them directly with potential consequences.
The characters created in the Rogues Gallery are non-player characters that the characters may interact with in a very limited capacity, but each game master may decide to expand their role in their game. An example is a doctor that may simply patch up a character and send them on their way. One game master may have that encounter be a quick one line in their adventure, while another game master may expand that character to become an ally, join the group, or just have a much more extensive interaction.

updates.update_content:
My apologies for the lack of updates.

The project is STILL crawling forward.

I did take a little break from the project as rewrite after rewrite was starting to become me just saying the same thing using a few different words here and there.

Things are on track to get everyone this first adventure by the end of the year (if not sooner). I, Shawn here, did take a step back for a few weeks to just get away from the rewrites as I found myself simply typing up different versions of the same scene again and again. 

Ready to jump back into it and finish up the last major rewrite and a few hours of a minor rewrite. After that it SHOULD all be layout.

Keith Scherer, several time GM of the year for EXILE GAME STUDIO, has been very kind to offer to playtest the scenario for us. After we get his notes we'll reach out to another GM or two, and then we will finally put THIS adventure to bed.

The next round of refunds will go out tomorrow night. 
For those sticking around we have some information.
1. Our initial playtest was delayed a week. We managed to play with a group of five players. We have received four out of five surveys returned, and the responses have been glowing.
A few of the sample questions:

1. All requests for refunds that we have received Paypal info for have been resolved. If you have not received a refund and desire one please reach out to us.
2. Operation: Pallbearer
Edits continue. It's the boring stuff of making sure all changes line up with other revisions, deleting redundant words, and tightening things up.

updates.update_content:
Good day all,
Last night we refunded ALL of the requests that have sent us their Paypal information. Refunds will end December 31st at Midnight Eastern U.S. time. 
NAZI HUNTER! OPERATION: PALLBEARER
For those sticking around, placing your pledge towards this project instead of Legacy of Darkness we have some great news!

REFUND UPDATE

We are dedicated to refunding everyone that requests a refund, but if you have not received it yet then we have hit a speed bump concerning your original payment method. The only way that we have seen that will fix this regardless of your country of origin is to use PAYPAL. Please contact us with your Paypal information through Kickstarter’s messaging service and we will begin processing those refunds.

For those of you that are sticking around or thinking about sticking around.

NAZI HUNTER: OPERATION PALLBEARER

Refund report: By this weekend we will begin reaching out to backers who we did not succeed in refunding after their initial request.

DANGER MAGNET! moving forward.

Some people have graciously made the choice that their pledge is an investment in DANGER MAGNET! and are sticking around even though Legacy is on the shelf.

What is next?
What can we expect?
Does any of this patience get rewarded?

NAZI HUNTER: OPERATION PALLBEARER is next.

When we decided on Legacy it was a toss-up between NAZI HUNTER and LEGACY. The first adventure OPERATION PALLBEARER is nearly complete and will act as an intro scenario to a Weird War, action, adventure, thrill ride. The initial concept was grounded in Hellboy, WW2 myths, legends, and rumors, and summer action movies. That was back in 2013. Now that OVERLORD has come out that has the feel that I aim to capture with NAZI HUNTER.

Those sticking around will receive it once it is approved and ready to go out into the world. I have learned my lesson about promising dates, so I’ll just say by the end of summer we expect to have this out for everyone.  We will post regular updates on NAZI HUNTER over on our DANGER MAGNET! Facebook page.

This is Shawn, one of the creators here, just so you know where this is coming from.
We have now processed two batches of refunds.
Tonight we attempted to process just a little over 30 refunds. Out of those only 12 actually went through. For each failed refund we received a red (maybe orange) error message stating the card on file for the backer wasn't up to date.

What happened?

There will be no throwing people under the bus, finger-pointing, or deflection in this update. This is all from my, Shawn Hilton’s, point of view, and the other creators can chime in if they disagree or clarify things if I am off base.

I believe the single biggest reason for Legacies failure was its success.

The original idea was a 4-6 hour adventure with the potential to expand it to around 3 sessions of gameplay and possibly 4 sessions for some groups that really embrace roleplaying.

As the Kickstarter grew financially this fun, simple, relatively short adventure began growing and mutating into something completely different than the original vision. Which I take the blame for. As it grew and grew I fully encouraged “and we can do this, and we can expand that, and we can revamp that portion into 3 new adventures”. The snowball grew from something easily tossed around into one hand until it was an avalanche enveloping everything.

The original vision could have been done by four friends and easily delivered on time. What we wound up with would have challenged a full-time crew of professionals, in my opinion, who made their livelihoods from writing and producing gaming material.  It outgrew and outpaced our abilities. Yet, at the time I don’t think a single member of the team could see that. We still thought we were handling that one snowball and tossing it around and didn’t notice that the avalanche behind us was about to engulf us.

With the original idea I and the rest of the crew would have sat down at a blank screen and said “10 pages here we go”, and we could have and would have conquered that material in a week or two. Instead, we sat down at our computers and said “120 pages for this one campaign which was always designed as an adventure, and then this extra adventure, and that extra adventure”. The weight of those pages just became overwhelming as each day seemed to make it heavier, then the original deadline passes and the weight doubled, and each passing week it just gets heavier and heavier until you’re fingers are completely immobilized, your brain is locked, and you’re dreading even looking at a keyboard and monitor.

The growth also led to massive internal problems with the adventure itself. What started as a film crew accidentally stumbling upon the treasure of Dracula and at the very end learns the twist ending of what really happened to the man/myth (I was about to type up the spoiler ending and stopped myself…maybe some point in the future it still happens) turns into a two-decade, globe-trotting, adventure that made no sense how one film crew would have done it all. Now keep in mind all the amazing art that we paid for upfront was based on those characters, and now, after months, we had to agree that it just didn’t work as that fun romp for those characters. Instead, we had to create an entirely new theme that would fit a model that would allow the characters to age over 10 to 15 years, give them the ability and reason to begin travel in Europe, then head back to the U.S. for three adventures (and it turned into 4 and the 5 adventures before we were done), and then head back to Europe for at least another 2 if not 3 adventures before we finally got to the finale.

The Legacy of Darkness had taken on its own name as it grew from a single action-adventure romp into a massive campaign that would have been more akin to and Adventure Path instead of a single adventure.

Yet, we still hadn’t thrown in the towel. We’d create a version of the adventure where the players could play our favorite film crew during sections if they wanted as one-shots, but the main campaign would now be designed for a group of college students in the middle of their studies. A lead-in adventure would kick off in Europe where they would have a major historical find and bring it back to their college, and from their things would kick off with adventures spanning the United States (New York, Chicago, and Louisanna were all destinations, and then I was going to jump in with another adventure as well).  The college students would be from Miskatonic so that Cthulhu fans could enjoy playing around campus.

All of that evolves from changing the basic premise of a simple action-adventure to this behemoth campaign.

That then led to the fact that we had to have new art commissioned to make it all work, a character creation guide for a student who would age 10 to 15 years over the campaign, and the myriad of other things that one small change here would cause to cascade into chaos down the line of adventures.

Even at this point, I think we were all still on board and thought “well it’s not going to be easy, but we can do it”. I had finished a first draft of the first European section, Mike had playtested his first adventure that would kick things off, and then we started playtesting Nich’s adventure when we realized we had to tighten up all the installments so they could fit seamlessly together, but one minor change in one adventure would force major changes in another adventure.

Adventure wise an ironclad outline would have helped, but as we added adventures tweaks had to be made and with the story now reaching out over nearly two decades as opposed to a weekend we had to figure out if character X had kids, how old those kids were, when did character Y die and did his kids keep the book that joined peoples souls to a master soul if they signed it in blood, and then it had gone from an adventure into a genealogy course.

Then there was real-world stuff, but that’s boring and everyone in the world faces the real-world stuff. Let’s just say that the real world began to infringe on the time that was available to delve into Dracula’s treasure and how it destroyed all those that possessed it.

Eventually, Mike had to bow out for very legitimate reasons. I still work with Mike nearly every week, we’re all great friends, but he had to step back and leave. That shifted more work around and plates got heavier as they filled up with more writing chores. It also left us without our Savage Worlds guy to do the conversions.

At this point, the avalanche had fully enveloped us and we were now trying to swim out, and while I was still eager to make it happen the nuggets of doubt had finally crept into my head. In my own head I was hearing “game over man, game over”, but I was going to fight it out some more. Eventually, I had to admit that I could do this. It could get done. However, it wouldn’t be what you had originally envisioned, it wouldn’t be the same adventure that you had sold (fun movie crew action-adventure romp to 15 years of college kids growing into the fields of expertise and traveling the globe), and at this point, you’re not going to be able to deliver this thing until around December of 2022. I also knew that growth wouldn’t stop there. At some point in an adventure, I was going to realize that Professor Armitages protégé had left the key to the restricted section in his dorm while he was trying to impress that cultist dedicated to Vlad Tepes, and that meant this entire section had to be re-written.

It was and is time to admit that the idea of the creation had outgrown the ability of the creators to contain it, and much like Wilbur’s brother in the Dunwich Horror things were going to end messy.

I believe that success led to the failure of Legacy.
I believe that the inability to limit myself to the original simple idea led to the failure of Legacy.

My piece of advice to others who want to go down this path: Keep it simple.

We have processed around 20 refunds so far.
I checked the funds this morning and it shows as PENDING.
I am not sure how long it takes to go from pending to completed, but I’ll keep on this.

However, nearly 1 out of every 5 refunds  were rejected by Kickstarter because they didn’t have updated info from the backer. Please make sure your information is up to date with Kickstarter.

EVERYONE that wants a refund will receive a refund.  

To get the refund process going we ask you to request a refund in the comments and we will process them in the order they come in. The reason for this is simply due to the amount of money on hand versus what is owed. Some people are going to be more patient than others and some will want to make sure they get refunded as quickly as possible. It will just take a little time to cover the difference in what is owed and what money is on hand.

Every refund will be made before the end of the year (and we have every intention of getting them all paid much quicker than that).

That is the official Danger Magnet! Statement.

Now from me personally (Shawn Hilton).

A few people, mostly personal friends, have reached out to let us know we can have all the time we need to finish the project.  That is incredibly generous, but progress has faltered to the point that it is just embarrassing at this point and I would rather put it out of its misery.

For those hard-core friends and fans that want to stick around, I can offer up some hope for future adventures. I have until the end of the year to produce new material for the Ubiquity System or I breach (and likely lose) my contract there. This would activate a termination clause that would cost me more money. If you have an interest in continuing your backing and putting it towards that project more info will follow soon.

Again EVERYONE that wants a refund will receive a refund regardless if you’re a stranger, a friend, or family. I will personally cover all refunds by the end of 2020 and highly likely sooner than that.

A final note for this post. All outside/freelance contributors (those not directly involved in the kickstarter) have been paid. All invoices have been paid. No creator, writer, artist, etc has been stiffed. All the bills have been cleared.

For those sticking around to read how it all went off the tracks. You must wait for the next update.
